data.scheme_name: Bihar Industrial Investment Promotion Poicy (Textile & Leather Poicy), 2022 - Tax related incentive - Male - General - MSE - New
data.benefits: Scheme provides 100% of the reimbursement for taxes with combined capping of 130% for Micro and Small Units for Freight Reimbursement & Tax related incentives.
data.eligibility: Applicable to Micro, Small, Medium, Large, and Mega units in textile and leather sectors.
data.conditions:
1. Applicant will get reimbursement against the admitted SGST deposited in the account of the State Government for a period of 5 years from the date of commencement of commercial production. 
  2. Under this scheme If any false declaration is given for the purpose of availing incentives or if incentives are availed for a unit that was not eligible or any violation of the condition of this policy, the amount of incentive is liable to be recovered from the date of availing such benet along with the interest compounded annually @ 18% per annum. 
  3. In case of non-payment within the stipulated time, the State Government may recover such amounts including interest as arrears of land revenue. 
  4. The unit availing subsidy under this policy shall remain in operation for a minimum period of 5 years from the date of disbursement of the last installment of incentives under Bihar Industrial Investment Promotion Policy (Textile & Leather Policy) with the exception of a Force Majeure that is extraordinary events or circumstances beyond human control such as an event described as an act of God (like a natural calamity) or events such as a war, strikes, riots, crimes (but not including negligence or wrong-doing, predictable/seasonal rain and any other events specically excluded in the clause). 
  5. If the unit shall become non-operational prior to 5 years from the date of disbursement of the last installment of incentives under Bihar Industrial Investment Promotion Policy (Textile & Leather Policy), then all subsidies availed by the unit shall be recovered along with interest compounded annually @ 18% per annum.
data.beneficiaries: Applicable to Micro, Small, Medium, Large, and Mega units in textile and leather sectors.
data.prerequisites:
1. Applicant will get reimbursement against the admitted SGST deposited in the account of the State Government for a period of 5 years from the date of commencement of commercial production. 
  2. Under this scheme If any false declaration is given for the purpose of availing incentives or if incentives are availed for a unit that was not eligible or any violation of the condition of this policy, the amount of incentive is liable to be recovered from the date of availing such benet along with the interest compounded annually @ 18% per annum. 
  3. In case of non-payment within the stipulated time, the State Government may recover such amounts including interest as arrears of land revenue. 
  4. The unit availing subsidy under this policy shall remain in operation for a minimum period of 5 years from the date of disbursement of the last installment of incentives under Bihar Industrial Investment Promotion Policy (Textile & Leather Policy) with the exception of a Force Majeure that is extraordinary events or circumstances beyond human control such as an event described as an act of God (like a natural calamity) or events such as a war, strikes, riots, crimes (but not including negligence or wrong-doing, predictable/seasonal rain and any other events specically excluded in the clause). 
  5. If the unit shall become non-operational prior to 5 years from the date of disbursement of the last installment of incentives under Bihar Industrial Investment Promotion Policy (Textile & Leather Policy), then all subsidies availed by the unit shall be recovered along with interest compounded annually @ 18% per annum.
data.context: Bihar Industrial Promotion Policy 2022 introduced to establish Bihar as a competitive and favored investment destination, achieve regional development, diversify exports, and augment livelihood opportunities for its people through resilient economic development.
data.objective: The objective of this scheme is to Improve and create a sustainable ecosystem for textile and leather sector Create entire value chain from ber to fashion Value addition to post production of khadi, silk, handloom, powerloom.
data.description: Scheme provides 100% of the reimbursement for taxes with combined capping of 130% for Micro and Small Units for Freight Reimbursement & Tax related incentives.
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply through this Link: https://swc2.bihar.gov.in/investor/register
data.funding_mechanism: The eligible units would be required to submit online application for Stage I clearance to avail incentives.
data.additional_info:
• Categorization of units under two Categories 
  1. Category A -Weaving, Knitting, Apparel & Garment, Apparel & Garment Accessories, Hosiery, Leather & Leatherette Garments, Leather & Leatherette Accessories and Leather & Leatherette Footwear and all kinds of footwears. 
  2. Category B-Spinning, Ginning, Textile Processing (Yarn, Printing), Man Made Fiber, Synthetic fiber,Polyester, Acrylic, Viscose, Rayon, Technical textile, Leather processing. 
  • Under this policy following units will not be eligible for any support under this policy: Units manufacturing narcotic drugs 
  • Units manufacturing alcoholic beverages 
  • Tobacco based industries 
  • Units manufacturing asbestos 
  • The above list will be called the negative list under the policy. 
  • The State Government shall have the right to decide whether a unit falls under the negative list and can modify the above list accordingly. 
  • As a general principle, any industry which impacts the environment adversely will be discouraged by the State Government for investment. 
  • Such industries will not be eligible for any incentive under this policy and be placed in the above mentioned negative list.
data.checklist_info_a:
PAN Card of the Proprietor
Aadhaar Card of the Proprietor
Address proof of the business
IT return of the Proprietor, if applicable
Audited financial statements of the Proprietor (last
3 years), if applicable
Firm registration certificate ( Partnership)
Registered deed of the Partnership (Partnership)
Society registration certificate ( Trust / Society )
Registered deed / Memorandum + Bye laws of the
Trust / Society (Trust / Society )
Certificate of Incorporation including Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association ( Company/LLP)
Detailed Project Report (DPR)
 Bank Appraisal Report
 Bank Sanction Letter
 Land Documents in the name of the Units
